Read each question carefully. Write your response in the space provided for each part of each question. Answers must be written out in paragraph form. Outlines, bulleted lists, or diagrams alone are not acceptable and will not be scored.

The <math alttext="p 53" overflow="scroll"><mstyle><mrow><mtext>p53</mtext></mrow></mstyle></math> protein is a transcription factor that regulates a cell's progression through the cell cycle after <math alttext="D N A" overflow="scroll"><mstyle><mrow><mtext>DNA</mtext></mrow></mstyle></math> is damaged by ultraviolet (<math alttext="U V" overflow="scroll"><mstyle><mrow><mtext>UV</mtext></mrow></mstyle></math>) radiation. The <math alttext="p 53" overflow="scroll"><mstyle><mrow><mtext>p53</mtext></mrow></mstyle></math> pathway is shown in Figure 1.

Figure 1. The role of <math alttext="p 53" overflow="scroll"><mstyle><mrow><mtext>p53</mtext></mrow></mstyle></math> in regulating cell cycle progression in response to <math alttext="D N A" overflow="scroll"> <mstyle> <mrow> <mtext>DNA</mtext> </mrow> </mstyle> </math> damage
content.question: (a) A skin cell completes one round of the cell cycle. Describe the products.

frqParts.text: (a) A skin cell completes one round of the cell cycle. Describe the products.

(b) Based on Figure 1, explain how <math alttext="p 53" display="inline" overflow="scroll"><mstyle><mrow><mtext>p53</mtext></mrow></mstyle></math> regulates the cell cycle in the presence of damaged <math alttext="D N A" display="inline" overflow="scroll"><mstyle><mrow><mtext>DNA</mtext></mrow></mstyle></math>.

(c) Draw an <math alttext="X" overflow="scroll"><mstyle><mrow><mtext>X</mtext></mrow></mstyle></math> on the template in the space provided for your response to indicate the phase during which the replication of damaged <math alttext="D N A" overflow="scroll"><mstyle><mrow><mtext>DNA</mtext></mrow></mstyle></math> would occur.

(d) Based on Figure 1, explain how a mutation to <math alttext="p 53" display="inline" overflow="scroll"><mstyle><mrow><mtext>p53</mtext></mrow></mstyle></math> may lead to an increased risk of cancer.
